description.highlights: The highlight of this design is its integration with the local geological features of the ancient volcano and the use of local materials to reflect the region's natural and historical aspects. It offers a unique blend of practicality and sculptural form, providing a new way for visitors to explore both architecture and nature.
description.shape: The external shape of the museum mimics a shield volcano, in line with Nanshan's original topography.
description.spatial design: The internal spiral structure allows visitors to move along an annular pathway to view the exhibits, providing a rich spatial experience and indoor-outdoor interaction.
description.material design: The highlight in its spatial and material design is the use of local materials, such as basalt and green bricks, for the facade decoration, which offers cost savings and reduces maintenance expenses.
